title: Gaming PC spec help
body:
Hey guys, i'm looking for some help on my decent budget gaming specs, i'm wondering if they can run CS GO and League at decent FPS, i don't need to play on ultra or high, med will be perfectly fine
Here are the specs, any suggestions would be appreciated, thanks.



CPU	Intel Pentium G3258 3.2GHz Dual-Core	(Mwave Australia Override) $85.99
Motherboard	ASRock H97M PRO4 Micro ATX LGA1150	(Mwave Australia Override) $109.00
Memory	G.Skill Ripjaws X Series 8GB (1 x 8GB) DDR3-1600	(Mwave Australia Override) $99.98
Storage	Seagate Barracuda 1TB 3.5" 7200RPM	$69.99
Video Card	Asus Radeon R7 250 1GB	(Mwave Australia Override) $98.98
Case	BitFenix Comrade ATX Mid Tower	$50.00
Power Supply	Silverstone 500W ATX12V	$50.00
Optical Drive	Samsung SH-224DB/RSBS DVD/CD Writer	$21.90
Operating System	Microsoft Windows 8.1 (OEM) (64-bit)	(Mwave Australia Override) $119.00
Monitor	BenQ GW2255 21.5"  $119.00

replies.body: I play with a 3.2ghz (OC'd to 3.4), 4gb of RAM and a GTX660 4GB. I used to play on a card comparable to the G-Card you have listed though. It'll be enough to run things like that decently, I would say. At least on mid to high, for LoL.
I nearly cried at those specs.
Err, any suggestions, i barely know anything about this kinda crap so yeah
